column5: I'm off to visit relatives who've rented something in Collingwood next week. I'll have my gear with me, including waders, just in case anyone's looking for the company of a doddering old fool for a day or part day of fishing. I've got some tentative plans with one member here, but those may go up in smoke depending on a certain about to be born babe. Even if the baby decides to be considerate and wait a while, which will make the dear little thing totally different than my own kids, I'll still have some other time to play as long as it's close to Collingwood. I hear there's some river fishing just west of the town but don't have any details. As I've said often enuf here, I'm open to new experiences of the fishing kind.  My wife and our cousins are happy to lay beside the pool all day every day but I get restless. We do that pool thang for four weeks every winter in Mexico. They won't even miss me here at home in Ontario.  JF
Why couldnt you be up there this weekend? Elvis is here,he LIVES in Collingwood didnt you know.
Ummm - that's why we waited till next week. Didn't wanna be tripping over Elvis clones all the time. I didn't particularly like Elvis when he was alive. I can sure do without him now.  JF

Here I thought you were a friend. I think he and Bruce Lee and Dale Earnhart SR, are hiding out to save the world. Enjoy yer stay no matter . I hear tell theres this Canadian Idole from there I only got a few days left to take off,since I got the bulk off  for the hunt in the fall,or I would make a trip out,just to meet ya John.  May you and the mrs,s enjoy your stay.
John why not go do some flyfishing on the Upper Beaver around Feversham. Or the Rocky Saugeen around Traverston.
Are the access points easy to locate? I'm happy fishing alone too. I just talk to myself more.  JF
Or hit the Bighead! is an amazing river
Thanks. If I run into Elvis I'll say hello fer ya.  I'm not far away so I'm sure we'll get a chance to meet up one of these days.  JF

Hell,If we had known each other 35 yrs ago,we could of met up no prblem. I was stationed in Newhamburg.LOL It was a small, bad boys home, where I hear theres a new car dealership now.lol South/west corner on the HWY.
Ford dealership at the first intersection and GM just up at the Bleams Rd  JF
Fly fishing, Bighead, and Upper Beaver!!! sounds XXX
Sounds like fun, huh?  JF
The most fun you can have without laffin'!!!
I sometimes giggle.  JF
It's just kinky when you use a feather John...         ... it's perverted when you use the whole chicken!

Access is okay you can just park on the South side of the bridge at Feversham and walk down into the gorge on the upstream side of the bridge. On the Rocky go one bridge downstream of Traverston. And the downstream part of that stretch is not posted. There are no big fish to be had but they are very willing and forgiving of beginner flyfisherman such as yourself. I recommend yu bring a handful of elk hair caddis size 14 & 16
Thank you, Duly noted.  JF
No comment.  JF
You can go to wasaga beach, meaford or thornbury all within 30 min drive or basically any trib/river along georgian bay for rainbow/salmon the river mouths are always a good start.
Umm Its July, fish dont start showing up till mid august at the earliest.
If you were closer we could have casted a few. I'm camping on the east side of Simcoe next week!
Thanks JB. But yer right. My absence might be noticed if I went that far away.  Some other time.  JF
